items.name: Dead Wax London Porter
items.desc:
A beer to fit tightly within our ethos at Orbit Beers, paying homage to European brewing heritage and traditions. Named after the runoff area on vinyl records, with a nod to Seven (named for the 7” single) our Double Brown Stout which we have brewed in previous winters at Orbit.
Dead Wax is our take on a classic London Porter. Based on the late nineteenth-century interpretation of the style. Complex rich malt, with aromas of chocolate, coffee, caramel and malty biscuit. More chocolate, coffee and black treacle on the palate. Rich full body, robust bitterness and a subtle earthy/lemony hop character combine to create a distinctively dry and drinkable dark ruby coloured beer.
5.5%
330ml
Vegan

items.name: Elderflower Sour
items.desc:
Packed full of freshly harvested Haschberg and Haidegg 13 and 17 Elderflowers from Silverhill Elderflowers in East Sussex. We took a trip out into the countryside to visit Silverhill on their farm near Tunbridge, where the day’s harvest had finished minutes before our arrival. We headed out across 15 acres of fields to examine the crop, before jumping back in the van with 10kg of German variety Elderflower heads to bring back to the brewery and get straight into the kettle at flameout for WLS043..
The result is this light coloured, spritzy, lightly sour and beautifully aromatic early summer beverage.
Enjoy straight or mix it into a summer cocktail.
4.5%
Not suitable for Vegans
Allergens: Milk, Cereals containing gluten

items.name: Hefeweizen
items.desc:
A Bavarian favourite characterised by its soft texture, subtle fruity banana and spicy clove yeast esters, and light citric tartness. Soft texture and mouthfeel, gentle graininess, relaxed hop bitterness, light citric tartness.
330ml
Vegan

items.name: India Pale Ale
items.desc: The 39th release in our White Label Series, this big, bold IPA is recursion in liquid form: a US-style IPA (originally based on UK IPA recipes) made with UK-grown malt and hops including Chinook and Cascade for grapefruit and pine aromas.

items.name: Ivo Pale Ale
items.desc:
Named for the founder of one of our favourite Independent record labels – 4AD. A man who’s name also inspired the opening track (Ivo) from 4AD band Cocteau Twins’ third album - Treasure.
Lovely golden colour with tropical guava, peach, pine and light citrus on the nose & the palate. Intensely hoppy, with oats for a smooth mouthfeel, & a dry bitter finish. Best enjoyed fresh.
4.5%
330ml
Vegan

items.name: Mixed Case of Core Beers
items.desc:
Experience the full range of our brews with a mixed case of our core beers.
Nico - Koln Lager
Ivo - Pale Ale
Peel - Belgian Pale
Dead Wax - London Porter (Currently Unavailable)
All core beers are vegan

items.name: Mixed Case of Core Beers and White Label Series
items.desc:
Get the full range of our beers with our mixed cases of Core Beers and White Label Series.
Box of 12 = 2 Nico, 2 Ivo, 2 Peel, 1 India Pale Ale, 1 Hefeweizen, 1 Prague Pilsner, 1 Elderflower Sour, 1 Tzatziki Sour, 1 Munich Dunkel
Box of 24 = 4 Nico, 4 Ivo, 4 Peel, 3 India Pale Ale, 1 Hefeweizen, 2 Elderflower Sour, 2 Prague Pilsner, 2 Tzatziki Sour, 2 Munich Dunkel
The exact makeup of the box could differ subject to availability.

items.name: Mixed Case of White Label Series (Special Releases)
items.desc:
Check out our more experimental beers with a mixed case of one-off specials from our White Label Series.
Current Selection:
WLS028 Tzatziki Sour 4.3%
WLS039 India Pale Ale 6.5%
WLS040 Prague Pilsner 5.1%
WLS041 Hefeweizen 5.2%
WLS042 Munich Dunkel 5.0%
WLS043 Elderflower Sour 4.8%
Makeup of case subject to availability

items.name: Munich Dunkel
items.desc:
Lagered through lockdown for a super clean, smooth beer. Deep, complex & rich malt flavours. Gentle, yet balanced, hop bitterness. Clean and smooth lagered taste, with a full malty body yet a dry & pleasing finish Appearance: Dark walnut brown with a red mahogany tint. Creamy tan head. Aroma: Toasted breadcrumbs, with notes of toffee, chocolate, and hazelnuts.
330ml
Vegan

items.name: Nico Köln Lager
items.desc:
Named for Christa Päffgen under her singing alias Nico.
Nico hailed from Cologne, the city of Kölsch, an obergäriges (top-fermented) lagerbier.
Pours pale golden. Fragrant herbal hop aroma with lemon citrus and green apple notes. Light on the palate, a touch of bready maltiness, with more assertive hop character. The crisp bitterness makes it eminently drinkable. Look for the pear drop notes from the distinctive Kölsch yeast.
4.5%
330ml
Vegan

items.name: Peel Belgian Pale Ale
items.desc:
Named for a DJ with one of the most eclectic musical palates in the game. A low strength beer in homage to his famous live studio recording sessions played out regularly on his radio show, and still enjoyed by BBC 6 Music listeners to this day.
Deep gold in colour and intensely hoppy, with banana, clove, bubblegum and spicy black pepper from the Belgian yeast strains and citrus & lime notes from NZ hop Motueka. It's low abv., sturdy bitterness, effervescent body and dry finish make Peel a great pairing beer. Try it with spicy foods & fish dishes or as part of a session!
4.3%
330ml
Vegan

items.name: Prague Pilsner
items.desc:
In February 2020 the Orbit Beers team went on our annual Beer pilgrimage, this year we headed to Prague and tasted some of the finest lagers in the world.
WLS040 was inspired by that journey. A classic Czech pilsner inspired in equal parts by the beers we know from Plzen, and the beers we drank on our trip to Prague.
Deep burnished gold in colour with a fluffy white head and soft carbonation. Pronounced woody & floral hop character, with background notes of lemon. Bready malt with a touch of caramel and delicate fruity yeast esters all in evidence. Smooth and rich mouthfeel, balanced with an upfront and present hop bitterness.
5.1%
Vegan

items.name: Tzatziki Sour
items.desc:
Berliner Weisse influenced kettle sour. Inspired by head brewer Pauls double summer holiday to Brussels, Belgium & Symi, Greece. A mildly tart sour beer emulating the flavours of the classic Greek yoghurt dip. A clean, vibrant & zingy summer refresher. Originally brewed by paul at Mad Hatter! We decided to bring the beer back to life down in south London. Straw yellow colour, hazy white foamy head, with aromas of cucumber, mint & lemon & lime citrus with a light malt character. Creamy smooth mouthfeel, with a mildly tart lactic sourness. Light & dry finish with mellow bitterness & soft to medium carbonation.
4.3%
Not suitable for Vegans
Allergens: Milk, Cereals containing gluten
